column4: Kindred Healthcare says it may revise or withdraw bid for Gentiva
column5: June 27 U.S. hospital operator Kindred Healthcare Inc said on Friday it was prepared to revise or withdraw its offer to buy Gentiva Health Services Inc   after reports that the home healthcare services provider may be trying to buy rival Amedisys Inc.

column5: Caesars Entertainment Corp.'s decision to close its Showboat casino makes it the second gambling house shuttered in what New Jersey Governor Chris Christie had called a crucial year for the future of gambling in Atlantic City.

column4: UPDATE 3-Caesars Entertainment to shut Showboat Atlantic City casino
column5: (Adds Atlantic City mayor quote  background on gaming in U.S.)

column4: Caesars Entertainment to shut Showboat Atlantic City casino
column5: June 27 Casino operator Caesars Entertainment Corp said it will shut its Showboat Atlantic City casino in August due to falling revenue and high property tax in Atlantic City.

column4: Sri Lankan hardline Buddhists say Facebook accounts blocked after violence
column5: COLOMBO  June 27 Buddhist activists accused of involvement in violence against Sri Lanka's minority Muslims said on Friday that accounts of their group's members on social media site Facebook had been blocked.

column4: Intel's sales chief to step down  advise on corporate strategy
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Intel Corp's global sales and marketing chief  Thomas Kilroy  will cede his position upon his return from extended medical leave on July 17  taking on an advisory role instead.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. FDA approves MannKind's inhaled insulin  Afrezza
column5: WASHINGTON  June 27 The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday it has approved MannKind Corp's  inhaled insulin  Afrezza  capping an arduous journey for the company and its octogenarian founder  Alfred Mann.

column4: U.S. FDA approves MannKind's diabetes therapy Afrezza
column5: WASHINGTON  June 27 The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday it has approved MannKind Corp's  inhaled insulin device  Afrezza  capping an arduous journey for the company and its octogenarian founder  Alfred Mann.

column4: Chalmers sets pace at Congressional  Woods toils
column5: While Tiger Woods mainly struggled in his first competitive round in three months  Australian Greg Chalmers birdied his last three holes to seize control of the Quicken Loans National in Bethesda  Maryland on Thursday.

column4: Chalmers sets pace at Congressional  Woods toils
column5: While Tiger Woods mainly struggled in his first competitive round in three months  Australian Greg Chalmers birdied his last three holes to seize control of the Quicken Loans National in Bethesda  Maryland on Thursday.

column4: Patient on Retrophin drug shows high liver enzyme levels
column5: June 27 Retrophin Inc said a patient dosed with its experimental neurological disorder drug was temporarily taken off the treatment after an elevation in liver enzyme levels  sending its shares down at 8.5 percent premarket.

column4: Maryland fast-food customer gets a bag of pot with her fries
column5: A Maryland woman who ordered a meal at a Sonic Corp fast-food restaurant got something extra with her French fries - a bag of marijuana.

column4: Maryland fast-food customer gets a bag of pot with her fries
column5: June 27 A Maryland woman who ordered a meal at a Sonic Corp fast-food restaurant got something extra with her French fries - a bag of marijuana.

column4: Tencent to buy 20 pct in 58.com for $736 mln
column5: June 27 Tencent Holdings Ltd  China's biggest listed tech firm  will buy a 20 percent stake in online classifieds company 58.com Inc for $736 million as the company looks to boost its presence in the e-commerce business.

column4: RPT-After 125 years  Alcoa looks beyond aluminum
column5: June 26 Alcoa Inc  the company that helped create the aluminum industry more than a century ago  is reinventing itself as a manufacturer of specialized components for aerospace and automotive customers  including some that contain no aluminum at all.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: (Adds Electrica  Allergan  Audika  Daimler and others; updates Fresenius Medical Care  Borussia Dortmund)

column4: Allergan  Ackman agree special meeting won't trigger poison pill
column5: Pershing Square Capital Management  led by activist investor William Ackman  and Allergan Inc  have agreed that calling a special meeting in an effort to elect new board members will not trigger Allergan's so-called "poison pill" measure  settling a lawsuit  the companies said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Allergan  Ackman agree special meeting won't trigger poison pill

column4: Slim's real estate arm to buy AT&T's America Movil stake
column5: MEXICO CITY Carlos Slim's real estate firm  Inmobiliaria Carso  will buy AT&T Inc's equity stake in America Movil  tightening the Mexican tycoon's control of his flagship telecommunications firm  according to a filing with Mexico's stock exchange on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Slim's real estate arm to buy AT&T's America Movil stake
column5: MEXICO CITY  June 27 Carlos Slim's real estate firm  Inmobiliaria Carso  will buy AT&T Inc's equity stake in America Movil  tightening the Mexican tycoon's control of his flagship telecommunications firm  according to a filing with Mexico's stock exchange on Friday.

column4: Slim's real estate arm to buy AT&T's America Movil stock
column5: MEXICO CITY  June 27 Carlos Slim's America Movil said on Friday it had authorized the Mexican tycoon's real estate firm Inmobiliaria Carso to buy more than 5.7 billion shares  formerly held by AT&T  equal to 8.27 percent of America Movil's stock.
